description: Returns a set of temporary security credentials for users who have been authenticated in a mobile or web application with a web identity provider.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: The AssumeRoleWithWebIdentity API allows an attacker to gain valid temporary AWS credentials through a web identity provider, enabling them to access AWS services with authenticated permissions.
If an attacker has compromised a web application, they can use the AssumeRoleWithWebIdentity API to escalate privileges or maintain persistence by obtaining temporary credentials.

researchLinks.description: From GitHub To Account Takeover: Misconfigured Actions Place GCP & AWS Accounts At Risk

securityImplications: Attackers might use AssumeRoleWithWebIdentity to impersonate legitimate users and gain unauthorized access to an AWS role.
